channel.title: Nature Communications
channel.description:
Nature Communications is an open access, multidisciplinary journal dedicated to publishing high-quality research in all areas of the biological, health, physical, chemical and Earth sciences. Papers published by the journal aim to represent important advances of significance to specialists within each field.

We are committed to providing an efficient service for both authors and readers. Our team of independent editors make rapid and fair publication decisions. Prompt dissemination of accepted papers to a wide readership and beyond is achieved through a programme of continuous online publication.

item.title: Operando interlayer expansion of multiscale curved graphene for volumetrically-efficient supercapacitors
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 15 September 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-63485-0

Supercapacitors are high-power energy storage devices that suffer from poor volumetric performance. Here, the authors demonstrate that unusually curved graphene crystallites exhibit rapid ion transport dynamics and enable the fabrication of thin electrodes for compact energy and power delivery.
item.dc:title: Operando interlayer expansion of multiscale curved graphene for volumetrically-efficient supercapacitors
item.dc:creator: Petar Jovanović
Meysam Sharifzadeh Mirshekarloo
Phillip Aitchison
Mahdokht Shaibani
Mainak Majumder

item.title: Directing selective solvent presentations at electrochemical interfaces to enable initially anode-free sodium metal batteries
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 15 September 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-63902-4

Electrolyte design faces challenges of balancing stability at both electrodes. Here, authors present an electrolyte design strategy to direct distinct solvent molecules to negative and positive electrodes respectively, achieving good stability in initially anode-free sodium metal batteries.
item.dc:title: Directing selective solvent presentations at electrochemical interfaces to enable initially anode-free sodium metal batteries
item.dc:creator: Qianli Xing
Jung Min Lee
Ziqi Yang
Reid C. Van Lehn
Fang Liu
